etymologies: Middle English: via Old French from Latin singulus, related to simplus ‘simple’

definitions: only one; not one of several

examples.text: the kingdom was ruled over by a single family

shortDefinitions: only one

definitions: regarded separately or as distinct from each other or others in a group

examples.text: she wrote down every single word
it's our single most popular beach

shortDefinitions: regarded as distinct from each other or others in group

definitions: even one (used for emphasis)

examples.text: they didn't receive a single reply

shortDefinitions: even one

definitions: designed or suitable for one person
shortDefinitions: designed or suitable for one person

definitions: not accompanied or supported by others; alone.
shortDefinitions: not accompanied by others

definitions: unmarried or not involved in a stable sexual relationship
shortDefinitions: unmarried or not involved in stable sexual relationship

definitions: consisting of one part

examples.text: the studio was a single large room

shortDefinitions: consisting of one part

definitions: (of a ticket) not valid for the return trip; one-way
shortDefinitions: valid for outward journey only, not for return

definitions: (of a flower) having only one whorl of petals

examples.text: the individual blooms can be single, semidouble, or fully double

shortDefinitions: (of flower) having only one whorl of petals

definitions: denoting an alcoholic drink that consists of one measure of liquor
shortDefinitions: denoting alcoholic drink that consists of one measure of spirits

definitions: free from duplicity or deceit; ingenuous
shortDefinitions: free from duplicity or deceit

definitions: an individual person or thing rather than part of a pair or a group.
shortDefinitions: individual person or thing rather than part of pair

definitions: a short record or CD featuring one main song or track.
shortDefinitions: short record or CD featuring one main song or track

definitions: people who are unmarried or not involved in a stable sexual relationship
shortDefinitions: people who are unmarried or not involved in stable sexual relationship

definitions: a one-way ticket.
shortDefinitions: ticket that is valid only for outward journey

definitions: a bedroom, especially in a hotel, that is suitable for one person.
shortDefinitions: bedroom that is suitable for one person

definitions: a single measure of liquor.
shortDefinitions: single measure of spirits

definitions: a one-dollar bill.
shortDefinitions: one-dollar note

definitions: a hit that allows the batter to reach first base safely.
shortDefinitions: hit which allows batter to proceed safely to first base

definitions: (especially in tennis and badminton) a game or competition for individual players, not pairs or teams.
shortDefinitions: game for individual players

definitions: choose someone or something from a group for special treatment

examples.text: one newspaper was singled out for criticism

shortDefinitions: choose person or thing from group for special treatment

definitions: hit a single
shortDefinitions: hit single

definitions: cause (a run) to be scored by hitting a single

examples.text: they each singled in a run

shortDefinitions: cause run to be scored by hitting single

definitions: advance (a runner) by hitting a single.
shortDefinitions: advance runner by hitting single
